important_phrase: Contacts along the Gulf   Coast continued to express concern that the lower pace of drilling permit   issuance and additional rig inspections would stifle future energy production   and investment
Credit conditions improved for segments   not related to residential construction and real estate
Labor markets across the District   continued to recover slowly
The majority of bankers stated that mortgage lending   standards have increased in recent months; while a few bankers reported elevated   standards remained unchanged
Since December, District   manufacturers experienced strong growth in new orders, while production levels   increased moderately
The outlook   for sales growth over the next several months improved slightly from our last   report, but the overall level of sales are expected to remain very low
District   vehicle sales improved from low volumes witnessed a year earlier
Outlooks are positive, with firms in most sectors expecting   either steady or improved growth in demand for their products and services

Capital and   technology spending at contacted firms is relatively unchanged
Contacts throughout the region expect modest increases or flat sales in 2011
Outlooks are generally cautiously optimistic,   with most contacts continuing to forecast slow and steady improvement in   2011
Corn and wheat prices increased during the reporting   period, while soybean prices changed little
Consumer spending increased at a slower pace, while the pace of   business spending was steady
Cost pressures increased in January and   early February
Wile   delinquencies remained elevated, loan quality continued to improve, albeit at a   slower pace than during the previous reporting period
Hiring picked up some

" Nonetheless,   several agents continued to report weak demand over the past six weeks, but they   expected demand to improve over the next six months
